name: places/ChIJoxnJwoJYwokRHjfgfptBGHk
formattedAddress: 648 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 648 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025-7456, USA

originalText.text:
The price to wash is $3.29, $5.29 or $6.29 depending on washer size. They all work fine but is it me or are they strangely priced.
Dry is $.30 for 6 minutes. I wish the dryers worked better. I dry my clothes for 45 minutes on high heat and when complete they still are slightly damp.
They need to stop Nickel and diming the old, young, least well off of their neighbors. Last week a wash was $3, $5, $6 and a dry $.25 for six min. The recent upgrade to a laundry card system was unnecessary and certainly was not worth the up-charge on my wash. It is somewhat clean and regularly staffed appropriately. I don’t expect much else in a laundromat.

originalText.text:
I've been a loyal customer at New York Wash for quite some time now, enjoying the convenience of their Wash and Fold services. Regrettably, my last experience was not only disappointing but also a costly one.

On a recent visit, I found bleach stains on top of my washed items which included my duvet cover, sheets, and pillowcases. To say I was devastated would be an understatement; these weren't just any items but some of the most expensive linens I had ever washed there.

What followed was a long drawn-out process of seeking reimbursement. At first, the staff seemed understanding and agreed on their mistake, assuring me of a full reimbursement. However, when presented with the cost of the damaged items, their tune changed abruptly, offering me a mere 50% of the actual replacement cost.

It was then that I had the (mis)fortune of dealing with the owner, Boris. Not only was his approach unprofessional, but he also lacked empathy towards a genuine problem that arose at his establishment.

In conclusion, New York Wash might seem appealing for routine laundry tasks. But when issues arise, be prepared for a convoluted process and an owner who unfortunately lacks the professionalism and empathy needed to run a customer-centric business.

originalText.text:
Took my laundry out of the dryer before it was dry and without asking me. Was standing right there with a timer on my phone.

All dryers full so couldn’t finish laundry.

The guy was helpful and communicative at the start though and prices pretty cheap.

Won’t be back unless I have to

originalText.text: Great laundromat. The place is pretty clean, the machines work well, and the card payment system is convenient and much easier than paying with coins. Can get busy in the evenings, but that's to be expected.

text.text: Great laundromat. The place is pretty clean, the machines work well, and the card payment system is convenient and much easier than paying with coins. Can get busy in the evenings, but that's to be expected.

originalText.text:
ZERO STARS****
I arrived just after 8pm to wash only. Although the laundromat is open until 10 pm the staff informed me that I could not do my laundry because they had to mop. I did not realize that they need 2 hours to mop this tiny laundromat. I will not return here. Terrible customer service!
